item.title: Report E-2024120248
item.description:
Report E-2024120248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured by a forklift. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024010054
item.description:
Report I-2024010054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: London
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IP Dizon noticed FA La Mura using a flashlight to assist customer (9G) locate his cell phone during first break • FAs noted the customer must have moved his seat electronically prior to notifying the crew • FAs located the customers damaged iPhone jammed in the fulcrum point of the seat • IP Dizon determined it was safe to manually move the seat and retrieve the device • IP Dizon then moved the seat using the manual switches underneath and retrieved the device • The phone appeared seriously damaged, both bent and cracked however there was no heat, smoke or flames present • All agreed it was best to stow the damaged iPhone in the TCB out of an abundance of caution • FA Ashar retrieved the TCB and the damaged device was placed inside

item.title: Report I-2024010023
item.description:
Report I-2024010023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximatly 1551 crew reported that the car was leaking from the manway when moved (Slosher) the car was immediately isolated and shipper was contacted. Shipper approved the use of PTRA contract Haz-Mat team to repair and remediate. Cause reported was loose manway bolts and no gasket., car was repaired, cleaned and released by Haz-Mat Special Services at 11 :21 AM on 01/06/24.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FedEx repack box found wet and torn when loading OB trailer. When Package handler indicated having skin irritation from contact with the package and its contents, product SDS was looked up and found to be a Hazardous Material Class 8 PG III. 4-1gal plastic bottles of Champion Acid Blue Next Generation Muriatic Acid in individual plastic bags inside 16"x16"x16" box and no additional packing material. Outer box had no markings. 1 bottle was found to have a crack in the seam under the handle causing it to spill acid into the box. Original shipment images show bottles in product box with printed Limited Quantity diamond and printed directional arrows.

item.title: Report E-2024120399
item.description:
Report E-2024120399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN3093 Manganese Nitrate Solution - 50% release from a 237-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 1’ area of the wood trailer floor. The tote appeared to be crushed and cracked as a result. The material was transferred from the damaged tote to a new one for shipment on. The damaged empty tote and impacted absorbents used to clean the spill were containerized into (2) 55-gallon vented poly drums and submerged in water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120398
item.description:
Report E-2024120398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN2922 Ancamine 2678 release from 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Pressurized contents will be repacked as prescribed.

  • Description: On December 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew broke down the impacted skid and utilized absorbents and cleaning agent to remove all paint from the surfaces. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024120366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An employee was unloading drums from a truck at Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Kansas City. As the employee was entering the truck on the forklift, the portable dock plate unexpectedly shifted, pushing the forklift forward quicker than expected resulting in the forks of the forklift to puncture the side of a drum containing hazardous waste (waste flammable liquids - Methyl Ethyl Ketone, Benzene). Less than a gallon of the material was spilled in the trailer, fully contained, and no further releases occurred. The spilled material was cleaned up appropriately and the punctured drum was overpacked.

item.title: Report X-2024120980
item.description:
Report X-2024120980

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS FACILITY ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED VIBRATING AND MAKING A LOUD NOISE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE ORBIT ELECTRIC SANDER WITH THE BATTERY ATTACHED THAT HAD ACTIVATED DURING TRANSPORTATION. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS ONE MILWAUKEE GRINDER WITH THE BATTERY ATTACHED. THE DEVICES HAVE NOT BEEN SECURED AGAINST MOVEMENT WITHIN THE OUTER PACKAGING OR PACKED TO PREVENT ACCIDENTAL ACTIVATION AND CONTACT WITH OTHER PIECES OF EQUIPMENT. ADDITIONALLY, TWO FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF TRU-GALV SILVER GALVANIZING COMPOUND AT 14-OUNCE ARE ALSO INSIDE THE BOX. LITHIUM BATTERIES AND CELLS ARE NOT AUTHORIZED TO BE PACKED IN THE SAME OUTER PACKAGING WITH FLAMMABLE GASES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MDT TO RFD.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO INSPECT APPROXIMATELY FIFTY-SIX AIR PACKAGES THAT FELT EXTREMELY COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FOOD. OUTER BOXES HAVE GREEN REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL STICKERS APPLIED AND ARE PREPRINTED TEMPERATURE SENSITIVE PRODUCT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES AROUND THE USA. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: Welshpool
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/16/2024 at approximately 1630, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4992313 at the ramp facility in Welshpool, Austria, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of various clothing items. Included in this package was a bottle of aerosol body spray and a bottle of cologne. The shipment is discovered during the X-Ray process and the ramp. Further confirmation revealed the contents, as an odor began to to emit from the package. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it was without the required marking, labeling, packaging or paperwork. Due the international location, the shipment will be sent for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120323
item.description:
Report E-2024120323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA, an incident occurred involving a 5-gallon container of sodium hydroxide solution. While being transferred to a pallet on the loading dock, it was discovered that the container's cap had not been properly secured. Consequently, a small amount of sodium hydroxide, less than a pint, leaked onto the concrete surface of the loading dock. Immediate action was taken to address the spill. Specialized spill cleanup material was used to solidify the leaked sodium hydroxide. Following safety protocols, both the original container and the used cleanup material were carefully overpacked into a larger 30-gallon drum for proper containment and disposal. After the initial response, the cap on the 5-gallon container was properly tightened to prevent further leakage. As a precautionary measure, the rest of the load was thoroughly inspected to ensure all other containers were secured properly. It was determined that all other caps were secure, and this particular container had been the only one overlooked during the initial preparation.

item.title: Report X-2024120887
item.description:
Report X-2024120887

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-15
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM CHINA TO THE USA WAS DISCOVERED BURNING AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE KENTUCKY. UPON INSPECTION THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL STATES PI 967 SECTION II WITH A DESCRIPTION OF LENOVO COMPUTER. THE PACKAGE CONTAINS ONE E14 GEN 6 THINKPAD. INITIAL INVESTIGATION REVEALS THE PACKAGE HAD CAUGHT FIRE AFTER BEING DAMAGED DURING TRANSPORTATION WHILE TRAVELING ON THE CONVEYOR BELTS AND ROLLERS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CHINA MAINLAND UNDER UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 925290, LCFC (HEFEI) ELECTRONICS TECHNOLOGY CO., LTD, $(SPB-A) NO. 3188-1, YUNGU ROAD, ECONOMIC, HEFEI CHINA MAINLAND 230601. A TELEPHONE REPORT WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON 15-DECEMBER-2024 UNDER NRC 1418974.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The Scrubbing Bubbles Toilet Bowl Cleaner Bubbly Bleach Gel and Scrubbing Bubbles Grime Fighter were leaking. 1 (leaking along the seam) plastic bottle of Scrubbing Bubbles Toilet Bowl Cleaner Bubbly Bleach Gel, 24 ounces (UN1760, Corrosive Liquid N.O.S. (Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Hypochlorite), Class 8, PGII. 2 (leaking from the top x1) Scrubbing Bubbles Grime Fighter Citrusx567 grams (UN 1950 Aerosols Non-Flammable, Class 2.2, 1 can is empty x (567g each) 2 aluminum Bottles of perfume Chanel Allure Homme (100 ml ea.), UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance Liquid 1 glass bottle Azzaro Wanted Perfume (50 ml) UN 3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance Liquid 1 aluminum can of Gillette Shaving Cream x 56 g, UN1950 Aerosols Non-Flammable, Class 2.2 1 plastic bottle of Purell Hand Sanitizer x 24 ounces (no release (Ethyl Alcohol) 4 glass bottles of Emoni Nail Fungus Treatment x 24ml each; 1 bottle leaked approx. 10 ml (possibly DG) Other nonhazardous products in the package that did not leak: Opti Nail Fungus Treatment, Neutrogena Shower gel, Dayquil Cough Medicine, Sensodyne Toothpaste, Aveeno Lotion, Jergens Lotion, Everyman Jack shampoo and lotion, Kerasal Multipurpose Nail Repair & Fungal nail renewal, Perfect Ten Skin Tag Remover All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCA experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate released from a 50 pound paper bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25 ounces of product released to a 20’ x 2’ trail from the metal trailer floor onto the concrete dock. The damaged bag was collected and all released material swept up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately 35-gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent, absorbents, and hand tools to clear all product from the site. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCA experienced a UN2922 Glutaraldehyde 50% release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and a 4’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor. Sodium bicarbonate was deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY THREE AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED AFTER THEY FELT COLD TO THE TOUCH. ADDITIONALLY ON THE BOTTOM PART OF EACH THERMAL TRACKING LABEL TWO PACKAGES HAVE A DESCRIPTION OF "ICE AT BOTTOM". ONE PACKAGE HAS A DESCRIPTION OF "ICE ON W". UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO ADDITIONAL CONSIGNEES IN NEVADA 1Z6V41060251517952 AND 1Z6V41060201502561. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pails due to a packaging defect. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120376
item.description:
Report E-2024120376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: DICKINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 12, 2024, at 1127 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Dickinson, TX regarding the release of Spent Hydroprocessing Catalyst. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 100 pounds of Spent Hydroprocessing Catalyst (UN3190, 4.2, II) from (1) metal tote onto soil. The release was reportedly due to the flatbed trailer rolling on its side causing one of the caps to come off the tote, impacting a 10' x 5' area of soil. Contractors also found that 0.5 gallons of motor oil and 0.25 gallons of diesel fuel spilled from the truck while it was on its side, impacting soil. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. A wrecker service removed the totes and up-righted the trailer. The impacted soil was scraped and collected, and the remainder of the spilled product was collected. Totes of remaining product were delivered to the consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (3) 55-gallon DM, which were taken to the consignee to be disposed of.

The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120937
item.description:
Report X-2024120937

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: MASON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Checker Driver states that he was unloading trailer 573131 in dock door 5 when he saw a giant super sack of UN2211, POLYMERIC BEADS EXPANDABLE, 9, PG III had a spool puncturing the sack on side and when he tried to carefully remove the freight, the sack busted and spilled an estimated 350LB onto the trailer floor. ABF driver states that the spool was loaded way too close at the previous facility which rubbed against it during transit and ultimately busting the sack. ABF driver states that amazingly, all 350LB of the powder has been contained on the trailer. Safety advised driver to take pi ctures and immediately close the trailer afterwards to avoid any additional spillage to occur. Safety contacted CURA and made sure that they look everywhere around the trailer to make sure none of it spilled out on to the dock or yard. ABF advised driver to send photos to Safety.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/06/2024 at approximately 2230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a hazardous material spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing two smaller boxes, each with 12 aerosol cans inside. Two one cans in one inner package accidentally discharged, resulting in spillage. The cause of the discharge is unknown. The discharged canisters were discarded, and the remainder of the shipment was placed in a salvage drum, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024120317
item.description:
Report E-2024120317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN2582 Ferric Chloride Solution DWG Grade release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 40’ x 40’ area of the concrete lot below. The tote was punctured by metal sticking out on the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were then collected into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120130
item.description:
Report E-2024120130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1971
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Local FRA Inspector Vincent Leishman discovered GBRX 711204 with a small leak and noted the BOV cap was loose. Minnesota Commercial Railway (MNNR) employees placed a tub under the bottom outlet cap to contain any leak and immediately called Rybak Company to fix the leak and clean any spill. Rybak noted they found wetness on the outside of the BOV cap and chains. The cap was found to be loose and contained approximately 1 cup of product. Upon inspection the BOV was found to have a minor leak past the internal valve seals that leaked one drip per 5 minutes time. Rybak cleaned the seals on the BOV cap and put it back on the car tool tight to seal the leak. The rail tie under the car had a small area of wetness approximately 8" by 12" without pooling. The car has been tagged home shop for repairs and an OTMA-1 was approved to move this car to the customer for offloading. The manway cover and other apparatus were inspected and found to be secure.

item.title: Report X-2024120978
item.description:
Report X-2024120978

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: ACWORTH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FOUR ROCKVILLE BATTERY PAR 61 ALUMINUM CASES ON WHEELS WERE INSPECTED TO DETERMINE IF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKS OR LABELS ARE REQUIRED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE CASES CONTAIN EIGHT ROCKVILLE BATTERY PAR 61 RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM BATTERY POWERED WASH LIGHTS. ONE CASE UNDER TRACKING NUMBER 1ZR366220110309926 CONTAINS SEVEN LITHIUM BATTERY POWERED WASH LIGHTS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IN THE SHIPMENT ARE 1ZR366220137501024, 1ZR366220115469905 AND 1ZR366220110309926. ALL FOUR PACKAGES HAVE RETURN DOCUMENTS ENCLOSED POUCH APPLIED WITH GROUND RETURN TRACKING NUMBERS TO BE USED DURING THE RETURN PROCESS WHEN EQUIPMENT RENTAL IS COMPLETE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER ALUMINUM CASES. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM GEORGIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER R36622, USE SLINGSHOT LLC., 6182 AUTUMN VIEW COVE NW, ACWORTH GA 30101-7681.

  • City: MARION

  • Description: DURING PACKAGE INSPECTION OF ONE AIR PACKAGE, WE DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX MARKED AND LABELED UN1018, CHLORODIFLUOROMETHANE WITH A NON-FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. THE BOX CONTAINED A 30 LB NET WEIGHT REFRIGERANT COMPRESSED CYLINDER THAT WEIGHS APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS. THERMAL LABEL PACKAGE WEIGHT IS INCORRECTLY SHOWN AS 30 LBS. OUTER BOX HAS A SINGLE ORIENTATION ARROW ON OPPOSITE SIDES, ONE BEING PARTIALLY COVERED BY THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER XX4527, NORTH STATE RENDERING, 15 SHIPPEE RD, OROVILLE, CA 95965-9297.

item.title: Report E-2024120375
item.description:
Report E-2024120375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: BETTLES
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 51000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 27, 2024, at 1647 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Wisemen, AK regarding the release of EMBR18276A. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 350 gallons of EMBR18276A (UN1993, 3, II) from (1) 350-gallon metal tote onto the ground. The release was reportedly due to a loose camlock fitting, impacting 30’ x 40’ and 8’ x 15’ areas of snow. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Impacted snow was removed and containerized. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (12) 55-gallon DM, which were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RR SHOP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3030
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 19th at 1715 hrs, personnel in the Buffalo & Pittsburgh Railroad's Butler Yard discovered tank car CBTX721497, a loaded tank car of Hydrocarbons, Liquid, NOS leaking from top fittings' protective housing cover. BPRR management promptly implemented their emergency response plan and isolated the rail car. The shipper, MPLX on behalf of Foster Gas was notified via CHEMTREC's report number 2024-11-20-00093. Additionally, the National Response Center (report# 1416851) was contacted regarding the release of product. Shawn Dunkle, MPLX Operations Supervisor, responded and discovered that the liquid line was partially open and the secondary closure camlock cap gasket was missing. Mr. Dunkle closed the liquid line valve and installed a new cam lock cap gasket to secure the container. To ensure the railcar's service equipment was working as designed, MPLX requested a post load securement test be performed. Specialized Professional Services (SPSI) pressured up the container to 15psi and found that the liquid line valve was defective (ball valve bypass). On 12/11/2024, SPSI performed a product transfer into tank car CBTX721426. The car owner, CIT Group is in the process of making arrangements to replace the defective liquid line valve. Non-Accident Report Index (NARRI); 5(5+5+0) x (2+0) = 100 NARRI; Non-Accident Release Code 300 (Liquid Line Valve Body - Other)

It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of ConvoClean Forte released from 1) 2.5 Gallon plastic container due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 4631484. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed an estimated 1-quart release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 12’x3’ area. The contractor applied citric acid to neutralize the release and used absorbent pads to clean-up the release. Two 55-gallon poly drums were generated for waste disposal containing loose-packed product, neutralized absorbent pads, cardboard, and PPE. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Empty LPG UN1075 residue car (GATX21086) was heard hissing and smelling of propane. SPSI was contacted and mobilized, arriving at 1230 hrs. SPSI met with Mechanical Manager Clinton Simons to obtain track protection for CN Runner track (616) via blue flag, brake set, switches locked. After safety briefing, SPSI crew climbed to top of car with MX4 to assess for leaks and applied Snoop around the PRD. It was determined the PRD was leaking. Crew used Indian Spring capping kit (64A) to cap off the PRD. Snoop was reapplied to verify there were no leaks present, waited 25 minutes before checking it again. No leaks were verified on the PRD. Clinton Simons was notified of findings, general housekeeping was performed of work area, and crew demobilized back to shop.
